reviews.text: This hotel is located a little outside Avallon and can be tricky to find without a good SatNav GPS. It's in a deep narrow gorge by a river and the location is very secluded and quiet, with extensive gardens and private gated parking for your car and valuables. It also closes very early in the evening, so phone ahead if you plan to arrive late, or you'll be locked out. I have stayed at the Moulin a number of times over the years and I visited once again this year en route to the coast.
reviews.title: Nice in parts, but maybe a little pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the good side I can say that since my last visit the rooms have been remodeled and are now modern and well lit inside with a nice new and clean bathroom. But the bed was far from comfortable, being rather tired and saggy, and this gave us a very poor night's sleep.
reviews.title: Old world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the negative, the whole situation of the hotel is rather dark, getting sunshine for only a few hours per day. When once there around midday, it was very sunny in the gardens by the heavily wooded river, but this is a rarity, and there are far more gloomy hours than sunny ones, due to the way shadow from the steep gorge falls.
reviews.title: Nowhere near town - that's the best part!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One reason for my choosing this hotel again was the free wi-fi, but it wasn't working when we stayed. Apologies were given, but no solution was possible.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was available, at an extra charge, but was not very extensive or varied. I would expect more for the extra cost.
reviews.title: A Gem
